actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-99, by Mr. Wheat.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2519. All points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 (l) (6) of rule XI and clause 7 of rule XXI are waived. During consider ation of the bill, all points of order against certain provisions of the bill are waived for failure to comply with clauses 2 and 6 of rul e XXI. Measure will be read by sectio n. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consid er en bloc the amendments numbered one, t wo, and three printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. Said amendments en bloc shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question in the House or in the Committee of the Whole.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 25.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 404 - 14 (Roll no. 138).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2519) making appropriations for the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and for sundry independent agencies, commissions, corporations, and offices for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2519 (appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2519) making appropriations for the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and for sundry independent agencies, commissions, corporations, and offices for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
